column4: hi. I am trying to get Ubuntu to see my MP3 player. When I execute lsusb I get the following entry : 'Bus 002 Device 004: ID 10d6:1100 Actions Semiconductor Co., Ltd MPMan MP-Ki 128 MP3 Player/Recorder' listed. But it does not pop up as a drive I can access?
there is not an entry preent. It was auto mounted during boot up.
according to fstab, there i no entry for mounting the external drive. It auto mounts either during boot up (if plugged in) or when plugged in mid-session. is that the problem?
what does the 'mount' line for it report?
It says this : '/dev/sda1 on /media/LACIE type vfat (rw,nosuid,nodev,quiet,shortname=mixed,uid=1000,gid=1000,umask=077,iocharset=utf8)'

Mount reports the following : '/dev/sda1 on /media/LACIE type vfat (rw,nosuid,nodev,quiet,shortname=mixed,uid=1000,gid=1000,umask=077,iocharset=utf8)'. Is it something to do with the 'nosuid', or the 'uid=1000' entry?
so I think that means that the mount is assigning me as the autorised person to use it? As both report UID as 1000, and 1000 = ted?
I think the umask should be 4 digits (ie umask=0077) - I'd try giving the disk a line in /etc/fstab (with the noauto option)
I will have a go at that and let you know. Give me 5 :-)

not sure if u still there, but in the end I just re-formatted the drive and recopied the data to it, and now it's less the wastebacket junk. Was just taking me too long to do a simple copy backup procedure.
